Utterance: Hi! It’s so nice to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing better. I started using a planner for my tasks.
That’s fantastic! How has that been working for you?
It’s really helped me feel more organized. I can see what I need to do each day.
That’s great to hear! Being organized can significantly reduce stress. Have you noticed any changes in your work performance or your feelings about work?
Yes, I feel less overwhelmed, and I’m able to focus more on my tasks.
That’s wonderful! It sounds like you’re making great strides. How about your interactions with your boss? Have you had a chance to practice assertiveness?
I did! I spoke up during a meeting when he made a belittling comment. I told him it wasn’t fair.
That’s a huge step! How did he respond?
He seemed surprised but didn’t push back. I felt really proud of myself.
You should be proud! Standing up for yourself is a significant achievement. How did it feel to assert yourself like that?
It felt empowering. I think I’ll be more confident moving forward.
That’s fantastic! Confidence can have a ripple effect in various areas of your life. Have you had any other interactions with your coworkers since then?
Yes, I’ve been trying to engage more with them. It’s nice to feel more connected.
That’s wonderful! Building those connections can enhance your work experience. Now, let’s talk about your family. Have you continued to reflect on your parents and the letters you wrote?
Yes, I think about them often, especially when I’m feeling down. Writing those letters has helped.
I’m glad to hear that. It’s a healthy way to process your emotions. Have you thought about creating a small ritual to honor their memory?
I have! I’m considering visiting their favorite places when I can.
That sounds like a lovely idea. It can be a meaningful way to feel connected to them. As we continue to explore your feelings, have you experienced any moments of sadness recently?
I have, but it’s more manageable now. I think I’m learning to cope better.
That’s a positive sign. It’s natural to have ups and downs. How have you been using your coping strategies during those moments?
I’ve been practicing mindfulness and journaling. It helps me process my feelings.
That’s great! Mindfulness can be especially helpful during tough times. Let’s also talk about your social activities. Have you been able to go out dancing or meet new friends?
Yes! I went to a salsa night last week and had a blast. I met a few new people.
That’s wonderful! It sounds like you’re building a supportive network. How do you feel about your social life now compared to when you first moved to L.A.?
I feel much more connected now. I’m glad I pushed myself to socialize.
That’s fantastic progress! As we wrap up today, what goals would you like to focus on for our next session?
I want to keep working on my assertiveness and maybe explore more about my feelings of sadness.
Those are excellent goals. We can delve deeper into those feelings and continue to strengthen your assertiveness skills. Does that sound good to you?
Yes, I’m looking forward to it.
I’m excited too! Remember to keep practicing your strategies and reach out to your new friends. You’re doing great work here.
Thank you, Ellie. I really appreciate your support.
You’re welcome! Have a wonderful week, and I’ll see you next time.
Bye!
Bye!
